page.title: 01The villages of St. Agnes
page.content: St. Agnes is a popular holiday village set in the spectacular cliffscape of the Heritage Coastline of north Cornwall. Mithian is a particularly quaint sleepy village of thatched cottages and more modern houses with its 16th century pub "The Miners Arms" at its centre. The village of Silverwell has frequently hosted the West of England Steam Traction Engine Annual Rally in August. A peaceful, rural community is found alongside the relics of a wealthy tin mining past; and the gaunt, deserted engine houses provide a spectacular backdrop for the setting sun. The hustle and bustle of the seasonal holiday trade sees everyone putting great effort into the annual Carnival and Victorian Fayre. In the mild winter climate many societies and clubs flourish in the community.
